issue.title: Port CLI to click
issue.body:
- [x] Color codes need to be ported, should retain compatibility with config values
- [x] https://github.com/mitsuhiko/click/issues/200 -- fixed in version 3.1
- [x] https://github.com/mitsuhiko/click/issues/201  -- fixed in 3.2
- [x] https://github.com/mitsuhiko/click/issues/205  -- fixed in 3.2
- [x] Write tests

Notes:
- Color codes are largely compatible, but they have different escape sequences.
- We depend on click 3.2

body: That's indeed a stupid regression.  I'm annoyed I did not have a testcase for this.  Trying to see how I can fix this.

issue.title: Use different method for propagating ctx.obj

repository.name: click
repository.description: Python composable command line interface toolkit

issue.title: Use different method for propagating ctx.obj

repository.name: click
repository.description: Python composable command line interface toolkit

issue.title: Documentation appears incorrect for passing context

repository.name: click
repository.description: Python composable command line interface toolkit

issue.body:
http://click.pocoo.org/6/commands/#passing-parameters

In this documentation, it looks like obj is initialized automatically by passing it in under the `if __name__` conditional.   

I haven't found that to be the case with click 6.7.  `ctx.obj` was constantly `None` until I initialized it to a hash in the `group` block listed here.  After that, it worked as expected.

https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/200

Is this normal behavior?
